reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is basic and the rooms are small ( well it is a town house). We were lucky, we had a balcony which made the stay ok. The breakfast could do with a choice of cereal, cornflakes are a bit boring after a few days. Tea/coffee tray was free but you had to ask for it. If you just want somewhere for B & B to explore the city it's a good place to stay. within easy reach of all the attractions but far anough away from the tourist centre to get a good sleep.
reviews.title: Basic but Fine

reviews.text: Fourth floor room was cramped and worn, old and dinghy carpets.The four flights of stairs were not fun but great exercise. Location was excellent although that particular block is a bit run down. Cat was great. Breakfast was very basic - wish they had real cheese and colder milk but hey, we ate for fuel. Reception will book shuttle to airport for you. We were fully aware this was a 2-star hotel so it was pretty much what we expected.
reviews.title: Hotel DiAnn was only ok

reviews.text: Do not believe the photos, there really isn't much beyond the outer architectural details of the building and the cute calico cat that offer any charm at the Hotel Di-Ann. In Holland, one of the lands of great cheeses, a processed cheese food is served at "breakfast"! The bathroom has such a slow shower drain that the entire room floods even for the swiftest of bathers. Any request is met with a smile and a shake of the head, but don't hold your breath, and don't thnk you won't be repeating that same request. They could do a few, easy things, and have a cleaner, more pleasant establishment. They have a good central location--the rest can and should be fixed!
reviews.title: Please stay away, onless you are a 20something!

reviews.text: My niece, her husband, and I spent 6 nights at Hotel Di-Ann and we enjoyed it alot. The stairs are indeed steep, but the staff carried my luggage upstairs for me. THANK YOU!!! We stayed in room 410, which overlooks the main street and the canal, so we had a window on each side and enjoyed the view down towards Koninklijk Palais and Dam Square, and also the view towards Westerkerk and the Ann Frank House. As far as breakfast, it was ample and fresh. The hotel cat was delightful and slept with me during a nap. Everyone was polite and helpful. The central location of the hotel beats out any complaints I could have possibly found. We chose the Schippol Connexxion shuttle from the airport which runs about 19 Euro round trip; can't beat that. There is a great restaurant right below the hotel on the corner (screaming lasagna; to die for). It's only a 10 minute walk to the train station, and trams and busses run right in front of the hotel. There is a canal taxi just 2 streets over, and a grocery store on the next block, across from the Westerkerk. Every museum was a nice walk away. I highly recommend this place.
reviews.title: I was pleased

likes.disliked: — I could often smell cigarette smoke from other rooms.

reviews.text: Don't like this hotel. Unfriendly staff, really messy room and halls. We had to ask for a rag to clean the room, because the staff didn't wipe it. They hadn't cleaned it for our arrival either. I wanted to ask for a vacuum cleaner aswell. We asked for the towels ourselves. Full of dust - the bedspread had old stains on it for example.
reviews.title: No thanks

reviews.text: Dirty toilet, the blanket sheet was used (!!) and full with unknown stains. We asked to change it with a clean one and we got an answer that they will change it only during the morning. The guy at the reception desk was smoking all night long and the smoke got straight to our room. The room was more liks a solitary confinement. We paid 140 euro per night. We left after one night and stayd for one night at the NH Doelen (4 stars hotel!) for 94 euro per night and two nights at the NH Tropen (3 stars hotel) for 56 euro per night - two excellent hotles.
reviews.title: Don't do it - Extremely tiny rooms, dirty and expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a decent 2 star hotel but nothing more. I have never seen a room this small before - about the width of a double bed, NO LIE, and a bathroom definitely meant for one. Intimate doesn't quite cover it!
reviews.title: Adequate 2 star - nothing more!

reviews.text: On the upside, it is very clean (except for the knickers I found on the stairs on day 2) and there are extremely friendly staff. The downside is there are far better locations such as on the peaceful canals (this, while central, over looks a busy road, you can only really see the canals if you can see around corners, or have one of the rooms right by Herengracht). Also when we stayed there were rowdy groups of stoners staying who stank out the hotel with fag/hash smoke, and i was woken up 2 out of 3 nights by the people in the room next door. they were not particularly loud, but the walls are SO ineffective, it only takes a conversation to bellow through and wake you.
reviews.title: good value, great location
Great View from Room
reviews.text: Also, watch out for the $20 deposit they take from you for the remote control and key. Why, goodness knows, although they do return it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cat is a BIG plus, but if you are at all allergic to cats, give it a miss - as she goes into the rooms and roams the corridors looking for friends. She even got into our bed at one point.
reviews.title: Tiny room, good location, ok breakfast, overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can i say? this hotel is the best place to stay in the whole of Amsterdam, the location was first class couldn't do better the people in the hotel were lovely, rooms were fine clean and tidy the main thing i look for. breakfast was nice too. We got a room with a balcony which overlooked the canal it was stunning - very romantic only had to look down the road and you could see the royal palace.
reviews.title: the place to stay in Torteguero

reviews.text: Overall i found Amsterdam fantastic everything is go all the time and the amount of bicycles in Amsterdam- well it must put bejing to shame! they are everywhere they even got parking tickets for their bikes when they parked them up against lamp posts! it's a different way of life and very enjoyable place to visit any time of the year we went in november and i was very surprised at how warm it was. if you go you should definitely stay at the di ann highly reccomend it!!
reviews.title: Great Place

likes.disliked: — hard boiled eggs hard to peel

reviews.text: Just returned from a trip to Amsterdam & Paris. Stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Di-Ann. The stairs are there, didn't think they were too bad tho. Had twin bedroom overlooking Raadhastradt , what a great view, a bit noisy , trams start early about 6am or so. Beds narrow but comfortable. Breakfast as others say, toast, hard boiled eggs, cheese slices , coffee or tea. Staff was very friendly, even the "night" guy mentioned in other reviews was friendly to us, maybe it takes a while to warm up to him. I would stay again.
reviews.title: fantastic!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we (two girls) stayed for two nights at the hotel di-ann, first impressions were the stairs!!! we needed help to get the cases up them!!! they are very steep and wind at the top! Second impression was the size of the room - you couldnt of had a guest to stay with you as there wouldnt be enough air to go round! no cat swinging here! We booked the hotel for its location - which is excellent, you can walk everywhere as you are not far from Dam Square. Breakfast was dissapointing - toast or cornflakes. But an excellent and hot shower made up for this! Staff are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.text: All in all we felt this was a good choice of hotel for value and its location.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room in this hotel was scruffy and cramped. it is claimed that the hotel was upgraded in about 1999 so i hate to think what the rooms were like then! we had a double room overlooking the gardens (nice view) but there was hardly room to swing a cat (or should that be kitten?). we had a small en-suite, a fridge but no drink making facilities.
reviews.title: scruffy and cramped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: staff were very friendly and the buffet breakfast adequate. the only saving grace for this hotel is its location directly behind the palace in dam square, only two minutes walk.
reviews.title: Authentic Amsterdam stay

reviews.text: i would not have minded so much but the room was not that cheap.
reviews.title: Hotel Di Ann~Perfect Location~Cute Cat~Tidy Room

likes.liked: — how close it was to everything
likes.disliked: — that it was hard to find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel Di Ann for one night on our frist stop of a 2 week trip through Europe. I picked the hotel because I wanted something more authentic, rather than staying in a typical hotle chain. I was not dissapointed! We arrived at about 6:30 am and they had our room ready. It was on the 4th floor so needless to say, there were a whole lot of steep steps to get there. The room was itty bitty and the bathroom was tiny but it served it's purpose well for one night. We also had a room with a little balcony, which helped make it feel less clausterphobic. Since we were only in the city for 2 days, we spent nearly no time in the room, so it really was needed just to sleep and shower in. The hotel was in an okay location but after walking around the city, we saw hotels we liked the locations of much better. Overall, this hotel is worth staying at if you can get a cheap rate and don't mind stairs.
reviews.title: More a hostel than a hotel

reviews.text: My friend and I were at the Hotel Di Ann this weekend and had a very pleasant stay. The infamous stairs were there and are very steep, not wheel chair or stroller friendly as there is no elevator. But we had no problems and the staff offer all the help you need. The hotel staff was very friendly and the cat is just too cute & very friendly! We had a room with a balcony (awesome views). The batthroom and room itself was satisfactory, both were clean and cozy. The room is a little small but has enough room....we didnt go to Amsterdam to hang out in our room the whole time. We needed a safe, clean & comfortable place to sleep and shower. The hotel is super close to resturants, shopping, coffee shops, places of interest and bars...Ann Frank House right around the corner. All in All, I WOULD DEFINATELY STAY AGAIN...THANKS TO THE HOTEL AND STAFF FOR A PLEASANT STAY!
reviews.title: Gives Dutch hotels a bad name

likes.liked: — The cat. The dining room decor. Um ... that's it.
